bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from James Carroll to Caroline Latimer, October 13, 1906

div1.p: Carroll thanks Latimer for the prompt return of his letters. He has discovered three more letters from Walter Reed and makes them all available to Latimer and Kelly.

div1.head: Letter from James Carroll to Caroline Latimer, October 13, 1906

opener.dateline:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
WASHINGTON.
October 13th 1906.

div1.p:
I
write to thank you for
the package of papers
just received and to
apologize for my
failure to write you
before I called the
other day. The reason
I did not make an
appointment was be-
cause I feared I might
not be able to keep it
because of the rush
in keeping up my
work and attending
the Herter lectures be-
sides. My disappointment
is gone because I wanted
to use the papers to-
night and they are here
in ample time. I am
very much obliged to
you for returning them
so promptly. I have
encountered three more of Dr Reed's
letters (you will justly note me
careless) and will send them to
you in a few days. Should you de-
sire any or all of them after Dr
Kelly's return, or at any time, I
shall hold them at your service.

I will try and take time to
peruse the book again before the
AC
C to Dr
date you mention but now that
you and Dr Kelly are familiar
with the important facts I feel
that the matter will be safe in
your hands.

With many thanks for your
courteous kindness, believe me,
